intro: Arboa madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar arbour vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Arboa madagascariensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
